books.title: Treasure Island
books.description: Jim Hawkins is a young boy who lives in an inn with his parents. One day, an old sailor named Billy Bones stays at the inn. Billy has a treasure map and is hunted by pirates. Jim finds the map and, with his friends Dr. Livesey and Squire Trelawney, embarks on an expedition to find the treasure.
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

books.title: A Confederacy of Dunces
books.description: Ignatius J. Reilly is an obese, lazy, and self-centered man who lives with his mother in New Orleans. He has a degree in English, but refuses to work and spends his days watching TV, eating junk food, and writing his magnum opus, a masterpiece that will never be finished. Ignatius clashes with everyone he meets, from his mother to his neighbors and even random strangers.
books.author: John Kennedy Toole

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.description: Pride and Prejudice is a novel of manners written by Jane Austen in 1813. The story follows the main character, Elizabeth Bennet, as she deals with issues of manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage in the society of the landed gentry of early 19th-century England. Elizabeth is the second of five daughters of a country gentleman living near the fictional town of Meryton in Hertfordshire, near London.
books.author: Jane Austen

books.title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
books.description: The Very Hungry Caterpillar is a children's picture book by Eric Carle, first published by the World Publishing Company in 1969. The book has been translated into 62 languages and has sold more than 50 million copies worldwide.  The story follows a caterpillar who eats his way through a variety of foods on his way to becoming a butterfly. The book is known for its colorful illustrations and its simple, repetitive text.
books.author: Eric Carle
